intro: Brachyglottis cassinioides, commonly known as the Cassini's brachyglottis, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows in coastal and lowland areas, thriving in well-drained soils. It has hairy, narrow leaves and is often found in shrubland or open forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
